Tidy a radf_obj object

Source: R/tidiers-radf.R
tidy.radf_obj.Rd

Summarizes information about radf_obj object.

# S3 method for radf_obj
tidy(x, format = c("wide", "long"), panel = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for radf_obj
augment(x, format = c("wide", "long"), panel = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x

An object of class radf_obj.
format

Long or wide format (default = "wide").
panel

If TRUE then returns the panel statistics
...

Further arguments passed to methods. Not used.

Value

A tibble::tibble()

Examples

# \donttest{
dta <- data.frame(psy1 = sim_psy1(n = 100), psy2 = sim_psy2(n = 100))

rfd <- radf(dta)

# Get the test statistic
tidy(rfd)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 4
#>   id      adf  sadf gsadf
#>   <fct> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 psy1  -2.34  2.92  3.04
#> 2 psy2  -2.22  5.15  5.15

# Get the test statisticsequences
augment(rfd)
#> # A tibble: 162 x 5
#>      key index id     badf bsadf
#>    <int> <dbl> <fct> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1    20    20 psy1  -1.01 -1.01
#>  2    21    21 psy1  -1.35 -1.30
#>  3    22    22 psy1  -1.77 -1.71
#>  4    23    23 psy1  -1.90 -1.75
#>  5    24    24 psy1  -1.95 -1.72
#>  6    25    25 psy1  -1.99 -1.77
#>  7    26    26 psy1  -1.96 -1.75
#>  8    27    27 psy1  -1.78 -1.26
#>  9    28    28 psy1  -2.07 -1.53
#> 10    29    29 psy1  -1.87 -1.34
#> # ... with 152 more rows

# Get the panel test statistic
tidy(rfd, panel = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>   gsadf_panel
#>         <dbl>
#> 1        1.79
# }
